intro: Chaetogastra gracilis var. australis, commonly known as the slender hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its fine, delicate blades and tufted growth habit. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. It has small, spike-like inflorescences that produce tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its botanical features make it an important component of native ecosystems and a subject of study in botany and ecology.
